intro: Blakea modica, commonly known as the golden blakea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and palmate leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
